xs.description: Extra small spacing (10px). Use for: tight padding in compact components, icon-to-text gaps, inline element spacing, dense data tables. Common in: badges, tags, compact buttons, chip components.

sm.description: Small spacing (12px). Use for: standard component internal padding, form field padding, list item padding, card content padding. Common in: buttons, inputs, dropdowns, list items.

md.description: Medium spacing (16px). DEFAULT spacing value. Use for: standard gaps between elements, modal padding, card padding, section padding within components. Most common spacing value in the system.

lg.description: Large spacing (20px). Use for: generous padding, separation between related groups, dialog/modal padding, card spacing. Creates breathing room without excessive whitespace.

xl.description: Extra large spacing (32px). Use for: major section separation, page-level margins, large component padding, hero sections. Creates significant visual separation between unrelated content areas.

xs.description: Extra small grid gap (8px). Use for: compact card grids, dense dashboard layouts, mobile-optimized grids, icon grids. Minimum comfortable gap for touch targets.

sm.description: Small grid gap (16px). Use for: standard card grids, form layouts, compact dashboard grids. Good default for most grid layouts.

md.description: Medium grid gap (24px). Use for: default content grids, spacious card layouts, comfortable dashboard grids. Balances density with readability.

lg.description: Large grid gap (32px). Use for: spacious card layouts, content grids, marketing pages. Good for layouts with larger cards or content blocks.

xl.description: Extra large grid gap (40px). Use for: hero grids, feature showcases, landing page layouts. Creates clear separation between grid items.

xxl.description: Double extra large grid gap (48px). Use for: maximum separation in grids, presentation layouts, sparse artistic layouts. Rarely needed - consider if layout needs restructuring.

xs.description: Quarter baseline (6.4px). Use for: list item spacing within tight lists, line spacing adjustments, micro-spacing in prose. Minimal vertical separation.

sm.description: Half baseline (12.8px). Use for: heading bottom margins, spacing after inline elements, paragraph-adjacent element spacing. Creates subtle but noticeable separation.

md.description: Single baseline (25.6px). DEFAULT prose spacing. Use for: paragraph margins, standard content block spacing, default vertical rhythm. One full line height of separation.

lg.description: 1.5 baselines (38.4px). Use for: heading top margins, spacing before new sections within content, emphasis breaks. Creates clear topic transitions.

xl.description: Double baseline (51.2px). Use for: major section breaks in prose, chapter-level separations, significant content divisions. Two full line heights of separation.

2xl.description: Triple baseline (76.8px). Use for: page section breaks, major content area separations, hero-to-content transitions. Maximum prose spacing - use sparingly.
